webforest 0.2.1

Create a reference line annotation

Source: R/classes-annotations.R
forest_refline.Rd

Adds a vertical reference line to the forest plot at a specified x-axis position. Commonly used to mark the null effect (e.g., 0 for differences, 1 for ratios) or other clinically meaningful thresholds.

forest_refline(
  x,
  label = NULL,
  style = c("dashed", "solid", "dotted"),
  color = NULL,
  width = 1,
  opacity = 0.6
)

Arguments

x

X-axis position for the line

label

Optional label text displayed near the line

style

Line style: "dashed" (default), "solid", or "dotted"

color

Line color. If NULL, uses theme default

width

Line width in pixels (default 1)

opacity

Line opacity from 0 to 1 (default 0.6)

Value

A ReferenceLine object

Examples

# Basic null line
forest_refline(1)
#> <webforest::ReferenceLine>
#>  @ x      : num 1
#>  @ label  : chr NA
#>  @ style  : chr "dashed"
#>  @ color  : chr NA
#>  @ width  : num 1
#>  @ opacity: num 0.6

# Labeled threshold with custom styling
forest_refline(0.5, label = "Clinically meaningful", style = "solid",
               width = 2, opacity = 0.8)
#> <webforest::ReferenceLine>
#>  @ x      : num 0.5
#>  @ label  : chr "Clinically meaningful"
#>  @ style  : chr "solid"
#>  @ color  : chr NA
#>  @ width  : num 2
#>  @ opacity: num 0.8
